cluster_classes.class_description: Technical and online channels through which stories are rapidly shared and disseminated, including the internet, social media, and other platforms and mediums.
cluster_classes.evidence_excerpt: internet and social media... stories can be shared and disseminated... across various platforms and mediums

members.entity_description: Global digital network enabling rapid sharing and dissemination of urban legend stories.
Online platforms that allow users to rapidly share and spread stories worldwide.
Various communication channels where stories are shared and reshared.

cluster_classes.class_description: High-level technological and communicative factors and processes that enable or accelerate the rapid transmission of information and stories.
cluster_classes.evidence_excerpt: advancements in technology and communication... This rapid transmission of information has led to the proliferation

members.entity_description: Improvements in technological tools and communication channels that enable faster story sharing.
Fast sharing and dissemination of information enabled by modern communication channels and technologies.

cluster_classes.class_description: Processes involved in how stories are communicated and altered across generations, including oral sharing, intergenerational passing-on, and gradual evolution of tales over time.
cluster_classes.evidence_excerpt: These tales were often shared orally, passed down from one generation to the next, and evolved over time...

members.entity_description: Practice of sharing tales verbally and passing them down between generations.
Process of stories being passed from one generation to the next.
Gradual modification of stories to match changing interests and fears.

cluster_classes.class_description: Processes involving exchange and movement that facilitate the spread of stories, myths, and legends between societies.
cluster_classes.evidence_excerpt: Through trade and travel, urban legends began to spread across regions and continents.

members.entity_description: Exchange of goods between societies, facilitating cultural and story diffusion.
Movement of people between places that helps spread stories and legends.

args.justification: The entity 'rapid transmission of information' describes a process by which stories spread between contexts, aligning better with 'Story Dissemination Processes' (trade, travel) than with the higher-level technological enabler class.

Digital communication channels are one of several mechanisms through which stories are disseminated and transmitted; assigning a shared class_group connects them with related process and enabler classes.
Information dissemination enablers are part of the same conceptual domain as other mechanisms that spread stories, so they should share a common class_group.

Story transmission processes (oral, intergenerational, evolutionary) are mechanisms by which stories move and change, fitting within the same overarching dissemination/transmission domain as the other classes.
Story dissemination processes via trade and travel, plus rapid transmission of information, are core mechanisms of story spread and should be grouped with other dissemination/transmission mechanisms.

executed_decisions.justification: The entity 'rapid transmission of information' describes a process by which stories spread between contexts, aligning better with 'Story Dissemination Processes' (trade, travel) than with the higher-level technological enabler class.

cluster_classes.class_description: Abstract ideas referring to phenomena beyond normal scientific explanation, including the general notion of the supernatural, the paranormal, and questions about their reality.
cluster_classes.evidence_excerpt: the supernatural or paranormal... leaving listeners to wonder about the existence of the supernatural

members.entity_description: Phenomena or entities believed to exist beyond or outside the laws of nature and normal scientific understanding, often featured in urban legends.
Events or phenomena that appear beyond normal scientific explanation, often linked to ghosts or hauntings.
Question of whether supernatural phenomena are real in listeners’ own lives.

cluster_classes.class_description: Specific entities, locations, or visual forms through which the supernatural is believed to appear in urban legends, such as haunted houses, ghostly apparitions, and mysterious creatures.
cluster_classes.evidence_excerpt: Stories of haunted houses, ghostly apparitions, and mysterious creatures have captivated audiences

members.entity_description: Houses believed to be inhabited or influenced by spirits or ghosts, often with dark or tragic pasts, commonly featured as locations in supernatural urban legends and folklore.
Unexplained or fantastical beings that appear as central entities in urban legend narratives.
Perceived visual manifestations of ghosts or spirits in urban legend narratives.

args.new_description: Abstract ideas referring to supernatural and paranormal phenomena in urban legends, including the general notion of the supernatural, the paranormal, and questions about their reality.
args.justification: This class cleanly represents high-level ideas about the supernatural and paranormal, which are closely related to but distinct from specific manifestations; assigning a shared Class_Group with the manifestations class clarifies their relationship while keeping them separate by abstraction level.

args.new_description: Specific entities, locations, and visual or creaturely forms through which the supernatural and paranormal are believed to appear in urban legends, such as haunted houses, ghostly apparitions, and mysterious creatures.
args.justification: This class consistently groups concrete manifestations (places, apparitions, creatures) of the supernatural and paranormal; assigning the same Class_Group as the abstract concepts class links them under a coherent domain while preserving a useful conceptual vs. manifestation distinction.

executed_decisions.new_description: Abstract ideas referring to supernatural and paranormal phenomena in urban legends, including the general notion of the supernatural, the paranormal, and questions about their reality.
executed_decisions.justification: This class cleanly represents high-level ideas about the supernatural and paranormal, which are closely related to but distinct from specific manifestations; assigning a shared Class_Group with the manifestations class clarifies their relationship while keeping them separate by abstraction level.

executed_decisions.new_description: Specific entities, locations, and visual or creaturely forms through which the supernatural and paranormal are believed to appear in urban legends, such as haunted houses, ghostly apparitions, and mysterious creatures.
executed_decisions.justification: This class consistently groups concrete manifestations (places, apparitions, creatures) of the supernatural and paranormal; assigning the same Class_Group as the abstract concepts class links them under a coherent domain while preserving a useful conceptual vs. manifestation distinction.

cluster_classes.class_description: Narrative forms in which urban legends are expressed and shared, including specific urban legend stories and closely related tales whose fact–fiction boundary is blurred.
cluster_classes.evidence_excerpt: Narrative stories, such as urban legends and similar tales, whose line between fact and fiction is often blurred.

members.entity_description: A modern folklore story, such as the Hook Man, widely shared in communities.
Narrative stories, such as urban legends and similar tales, whose line between fact and fiction is often blurred for listeners.
Narratives, including urban legends, that can be quickly shared via internet and social media.

cluster_classes.class_description: Documents that analyze the origins, societal impact, and persistence of urban legends.
cluster_classes.evidence_excerpt: An essay discussing the origins, societal impact, and endurance of urban legends.

members.entity_description: An essay discussing the origins, societal impact, and endurance of urban legends.

splits.name: Urban Legend Genre
splits.description: The abstract modern folklore genre of urban legends, treated as a narrative type distinct from individual stories or examples.

args.justification: The entity 'urban legend' (En_9c20138b) represents the abstract narrative genre, while the other members describe concrete stories/tales; splitting isolates the genre concept from specific narrative instances for cleaner schema.

args.new_description: Specific urban legend stories and closely related modern folklore narratives whose boundary between fact and fiction is blurred, including those shared via the internet and social media.
args.justification: After splitting out the abstract genre entity, the remaining members describe specific stories/tales; renaming and updating the type hint and class_group clarifies this scope and connects it to related urban legend classes.

args.new_description: The modern folklore narrative genre characterized by purportedly true stories such as the Hook Man and similar tales, independent of any particular telling.
args.justification: The split-out class groups the abstract concept of the urban legend narrative type; assigning a clear name, refined description, and shared class_group aligns it with related urban legend material.

args.new_description: Documents and analyses that examine the origins, societal impact, cultural meanings, and persistence of urban legends as a modern folklore genre.
args.justification: This class covers scholarly or analytical documents about urban legends rather than narratives themselves; assigning the same class_group as the narrative and genre classes ties together the domain of urban legend folklore.

executed_decisions.justification: The entity 'urban legend' (En_9c20138b) represents the abstract narrative genre, while the other members describe concrete stories/tales; splitting isolates the genre concept from specific narrative instances for cleaner schema.

cluster_classes.class_description: Key components of a specific urban legend scenario, including the protagonists, setting, and triggering information source within the same narrative.

members.entity_description: Attractive pull of unexplained or mysterious aspects of stories.
Enjoyable excitement people experience when frightened by stories.

Unresolved questions and enigmatic situations that sustain the appeal of urban legends.

cluster_classes.class_description: Constituent elements in cautionary urban legend narratives, including vulnerable targets and the lures or objects used to entice them.
cluster_classes.evidence_excerpt: Stories of strangers luring children with candy ... warn listeners about the dangers that lurk

members.entity_description: Sweet treats used as bait by strangers in cautionary urban legend narratives.
Young individuals portrayed as vulnerable targets in the candy-luring urban legend.

args.new_description: Constituent narrative elements of specific urban legend scenarios, including protagonists, vulnerable targets, settings, and lures or information sources that trigger or drive the story.
args.justification: Both classes enumerate concrete roles, settings, and objects within specific urban legend scenarios (e.g., young couple, children, secluded area, candy) and serve the same function as narrative scenario elements, so they should be unified into a single, broader class.
The merged class represents concrete components of urban legend narratives and should be grouped under a shared Urban Legends class_group to align with related thematic classes.
This class captures psychological and thematic aspects that sustain the appeal of urban legends, so it should share the same Urban Legends class_group as the narrative scenario elements.

members.entity_description: A fugitive offender described in the news report, central to the Hook Man legend.
A metal hook replacing the criminal’s hand, a defining feature of the Hook Man.

remarks: After splitting out the antagonist and hook weapon, this class should only retain additional Hook Man narrative elements as they appear; review in future iterations to see if it is still needed or can be retired.

splits.name: Hook Man Antagonist
splits.description: The escaped criminal figure in the Hook Man legend, characterized as the dangerous human antagonist.

splits.name: Hook Man Hook Weapon
splits.description: The metal hook that replaces the antagonist's hand in the Hook Man legend, treated as a distinct iconic object/weapon.

args.justification: ClsC_869aa707 currently mixes two distinct concepts—a character (escaped criminal) and an object/physical attribute (hook for a hand); splitting yields cleaner, semantically coherent classes for the antagonist and his hook.

args.new_description: Entities representing the Hook Man urban legend as a whole (the canonical legend) and particular tellings or narrative instances of that legend.
args.justification: Renaming and refining ClsC_746fdaf8 clarifies that it covers the overall Hook Man legend and specific tellings, and assigning the class group connects it to other Hook Man–related classes.

args.new_description: Residual container for any remaining narrative elements of the Hook Man legend not captured by more specific classes (e.g., antagonist, hook weapon).

args.new_description: The metal hook that replaces the antagonist's hand and functions as an iconic weapon and visual symbol within the Hook Man legend.
args.justification: Assigning a clear name, description, and Hook Man class group to the newly split hook-weapon class captures its role as a distinct iconic object within the legend.

args.new_description: Sensory and physical cues (such as sounds and objects) that signify danger and escalate fear in the Hook Man urban legend.
args.justification: Refines the label to emphasize these are threat cues within a narrative and connects them via the Urban Legend Narrative Elements Class_Group to related scene components and motifs.

args.new_description: Cautionary motifs in folklore and urban legends (e.g., strangers luring children with candy, cursed objects) that warn about hidden dangers and harmful forces.
args.justification: Clarifies that the motifs are specifically within urban legends and unifies them under the same Urban Legend Narrative Elements Class_Group as other legend-related classes.

executed_decisions.new_description: Physical components of the vehicle door assembly as they appear within the Hook Man urban legend scene.
executed_decisions.justification: Aligns the class name/description with its specific narrative function and groups it under a shared Urban Legend Narrative Elements Class_Group with related legend elements.

executed_decisions.new_description: Sensory and physical cues (such as sounds and objects) that signify danger and escalate fear in the Hook Man urban legend.
executed_decisions.justification: Refines the label to emphasize these are threat cues within a narrative and connects them via the Urban Legend Narrative Elements Class_Group to related scene components and motifs.

executed_decisions.new_description: Cautionary motifs in folklore and urban legends (e.g., strangers luring children with candy, cursed objects) that warn about hidden dangers and harmful forces.
executed_decisions.justification: Clarifies that the motifs are specifically within urban legends and unifies them under the same Urban Legend Narrative Elements Class_Group as other legend-related classes.

cluster_classes.class_description: Concepts related to how urban legends function as warnings, including both the cautionary narratives themselves and the generalized threats they emphasize.
cluster_classes.evidence_excerpt: Stories ... warn listeners about the dangers that lurk in the world around them.

members.entity_description: Stories designed to warn listeners about dangers or undesirable behaviors, conveying moral or safety lessons by illustrating dangers or negative outcomes.

members.entity_name: dangers that lurk in the world
members.entity_description: Generalized threats and risks in everyday life that urban legends symbolically warn against.

cluster_classes.class_description: Emotional and conceptual fears that urban legends reflect or evoke at the societal level, including general social anxieties and specific fears such as fear of the unknown.
cluster_classes.evidence_excerpt: Urban legends symbolically represent collective social concerns, including fear of the unknown and fears to be faced.

members.entity_description: Collective social worries, concerns, and emotional tensions that urban legends symbolically represent and reflect.
A core emotional theme underlying the Hook Man and similar urban legends.
Challenges and frightening concerns that people confront, fueling interest in urban legends.

cluster_classes.class_description: Concepts describing sensed or imagined danger in urban legends, focusing on the presence of possible harm regardless of whether it is real.
cluster_classes.evidence_excerpt: Legends emphasize a persistent sense of possible harm and perceived threats, real or imagined.

members.entity_description: A persistent sense of possible harm emphasized in the legend’s narrative.
Threats believed or imagined by communities, regardless of whether they are real.

args.new_description: Concepts related to how urban legends function as cautionary warnings and emphasize real or perceived threats and dangers, including both the warning narratives themselves and the sense of possible harm they highlight.
args.justification: Both classes describe closely overlapping ideas of dangers, threats, and warnings in urban legends—one focusing on cautionary tales and generalized dangers, the other on perceived and sensed threats—so they should be unified into a single coherent warning/threat concept class.

args.new_class_group: Urban Legend Fear and Risk Themes
args.justification: The merged class captures warning narratives and emphasized threats within urban legends and should be grouped with broader fear and risk-related themes under a shared, domain-appropriate Class_Group.

args.new_class_group: Urban Legend Fear and Risk Themes
args.justification: Collective societal fears and anxieties reflected in urban legends are conceptually related to warnings and threats in those legends, so assigning the same Class_Group connects these distinct but related fear and risk themes.

executed_decisions.justification: Both classes describe closely overlapping ideas of dangers, threats, and warnings in urban legends—one focusing on cautionary tales and generalized dangers, the other on perceived and sensed threats—so they should be unified into a single coherent warning/threat concept class.

executed_decisions.new_class_group: Urban Legend Fear and Risk Themes
executed_decisions.justification: The merged class captures warning narratives and emphasized threats within urban legends and should be grouped with broader fear and risk-related themes under a shared, domain-appropriate Class_Group.

executed_decisions.new_class_group: Urban Legend Fear and Risk Themes
executed_decisions.justification: Collective societal fears and anxieties reflected in urban legends are conceptually related to warnings and threats in those legends, so assigning the same Class_Group connects these distinct but related fear and risk themes.

cluster_classes.class_description: Human roles involved in urban legends, including both the threatening figures within the stories and the audience who receive the cautionary message.
cluster_classes.evidence_excerpt: Stories of strangers luring children... and cursed objects warn listeners about the dangers that lurk in the world around them.

members.entity_description: Unfamiliar adults depicted as potential threats to children in cautionary urban legends.
People who hear urban legends and receive their implied warnings about danger.

args.new_class_group: Folklore & Urban Legends – Narrative Social Roles
args.justification: The class clearly groups human social roles within urban legends (threatening figures and audience), so assigning a Class_Group focused on social roles in folklore/urban legend narratives connects it to an appropriate domain-level category.

executed_decisions.new_class_group: Folklore & Urban Legends – Narrative Social Roles
executed_decisions.justification: The class clearly groups human social roles within urban legends (threatening figures and audience), so assigning a Class_Group focused on social roles in folklore/urban legend narratives connects it to an appropriate domain-level category.
